title.rendered: Sage Steele Kimzey: Net Worth 2023, Career Earnings, Salary

content.rendered:
Summary

  • About Sage Kimzey
    • Early Life
    • Early Career
    • Professional Career
  • Sage Kimzey’s Net Worth
    • Career Earnings

  • Personal Details About Sage Kimzey

    • FAQs About Sage Kimzey
  • Conclusion

Sage Steele Kimzey, a name that resonates with power and determination in professional rodeo. Born on August 26, 1994, in Strong City, Oklahoma, Kimzey has carved a niche for himself in the bull riding circuit, winning seven PRCA bull riding world championships and setting numerous records.

This article delves into the life and career of this rodeo cowboy, exploring his early life, professional career, personal details, and more.

About Sage Kimzey

Sage Steele Kimzey was born on August 26, 1994, in Strong City, Oklahoma, United States. His father, Ted Kimzey, was a PRCA barrelman who also worked at the National Finals Rodeo (NFR) in 1980 and 1987.

His mother, Jennifer, is the CEO of Gold Buckle Realty. Sage has an older sister, Dusta, a pharmacist, and a younger brother, Trey, who followed in his footsteps to become a bull rider.

Sage Kimzey graduated from Cheyenne High School in Oklahoma and played basketball for four years. His team won the state championship in his senior year. He later attended Southwestern Oklahoma State University in Weatherford.

Early Life

Sage Kimzey’s early life was deeply rooted in the rodeo culture, thanks to his father’s involvement in the PRCA. His upbringing in Strong City, Oklahoma, known for its rodeo culture, further fueled his passion for the sport.

His family, including his mother and siblings, also sideline as trick riders, indicating the deep-seated rodeo culture in his family.

Early Career

Sage Kimzey turned pro in 2013, debuting in the rodeo circuit. His early career was marked by determination and hard work, which quickly paid off as he started making a name for himself in the bull riding circuit.

Professional Career

Sage Kimzey’s professional career is nothing short of remarkable. He competes in the Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association (PRCA) and Professional Bull Riders (PBR) circuits.

He has won seven PRCA bull riding world championships and was a three-time world champion in the now-defunct Championship Bull Riding (CBR) organization.

In 2017, at the age of 22, Kimzey became the PRCA’s youngest millionaire after winning his third straight world championship. As of 2023, he rides for the Carolina Cowboys during the PBR Team Series season.

Sage Kimzey’s Net Worth

As of 2023, the net worth of Sage Kimzey, a renowned bull rider from the United States, is estimated to be around $5 million, according to one source.

Career Earnings

Salary

Sage Kimzey is a professional bull rider who has won the PBR World Championship three times. His salary is not publicly disclosed, but he is estimated to earn over $1 million per year.

According to the Professional Bull Riders website, the average salary for a top bull rider is around $250,000 per year. However, Kimzey is one of the most successful bull riders in the world, and he likely earns significantly more than that.

Endorsements

Sage Kimzey, the renowned bull rider, has been associated with several endorsements throughout his career. One of his notable endorsements is with Community Coffee, a family-owned retail coffee brand.

In 2022, Kimzey was among the 18 elite rodeo athletes who proudly wore the Community Coffee endorsement.

In addition to his endorsement deals, Kimzey has been involved in philanthropic activities.

For instance, he pledged $10 for every point he scored during the National Finals Rodeo (NFR) to the American Valor Foundation, a non-profit organization that supports veterans.

Personal Details About Sage Kimzey

Wife

Sage Steele Kimzey, a seven-time PRCA Bull Riding World Champion, is married to Alexis Bloomer, an award-winning journalist and entrepreneur.

They got married in October 2020. Alexis is also known for her perfume and candle industry ventures with her brand, Saved Scents. The couple welcomed their first child, a son named Steele Randall Kimzey, into the world on January 26, 2022.

The birth of their son was a significant event in their lives, with Sage Kimzey describing how becoming a father changed his perspective on life.

The couple has been together for nearly a decade, and their relationship is characterized by mutual support and companionship. Alexis has been a constant presence at Sage’s contests, and her support has been instrumental in Sage’s career, including when he launched his brand, Be Legendary. They currently reside in Salado, Texas.

Age

As of 2023, Sage Kimzey is 29 years old.

Height and Weight

Sage Kimzey stands at a height of 5 ft 8 in (1.73 m) and weighs approximately 150 lb (68 kg).

Career Stats

FAQs About Sage Kimzey

When was Sage Kimzey born?

Sage Kimzey was born on August 26, 1994.

Who are Sage Kimzey’s parents?

Sage Kimzey’s father is Ted Kimzey, a PRCA barrelman, and his mother is Jennifer Kimzey, the CEO of Gold Buckle Realty1.

What is Sage Kimzey’s net worth in 2023?

As of 2023, Sage Kimzey’s net worth is around $5 million.

Who is Sage Kimzey’s wife?

Sage Kimzey is married to Alexis Bloomer, a journalist and entrepreneur.

How many PRCA bull riding world championships has Sage Kimzey won?

Sage Kimzey has won seven PRCA bull riding world championships.

Conclusion

Sage Kimzey’s journey from a young boy in Strong City, Oklahoma, to a seven-time PRCA bull riding world champion is a testament to his talent, determination, and passion for the sport.

His achievements have made him a household name in the world of rodeo and an inspiration for aspiring bull riders. As he continues to compete and set new records, there’s no doubt that Sage Kimzey’s legacy in the rodeo world will continue to grow.
